courses.name: Special Project in Bioinformatics and Computational Biology

cmCourseInfo.description: An opportunity for specialized individual research in bioinformatics and computational biology by arrangement with a supervisor. Approval of the application by the BCB coordinator is required. Not eligible for CR/NCR option.
cmCourseInfo.title: Special Project in Bioinformatics and Computational Biology
cmCourseInfo.prerequisitesText: Permission of the course coordinator (application required). Significant background in both life science and computer science courses is required.

breadthTypes.description: BR=5 The Physical and Mathematical Universes

notes.name: Course Note
notes.content:
Timetable Instructions

For more information about these courses, please visit: https://bcb.csb.utoronto.ca/. To enrol in these courses, please send an email with your student ID along with the completed registration form (available on the BCB website) to m.casco@utoronto.ca.

Delivery Instructions

The delivery of independent research courses is unique to each project. The project is typically designed by the supervisor with input from the student. Students are responsible for contacting possible supervisors. Students will work primarily on their own, but are required to meet with their supervisors at mutually convenient times throughout the term. In-person research will only proceed if it is safe and practical to do so, in accordance with university directives.

cmCourseInfo.description: Practical introduction to concepts, standards and tools for the implementation of strategies in bioinformatics and computational biology. Student led discussions plus a strong component of hands-on exercises.
cmCourseInfo.title: Applied Bioinformatics
cmCourseInfo.prerequisitesText: BCH311H1/MGY311Y1; (CSC324H1/CSC373H1/CSC375H1) or permission of the course coordinator

breadthTypes.description: BR=5 The Physical and Mathematical Universes

notes.name: Course Note
notes.content:
Timetable Instructions

 

For more information about this course, please visit the course website: https://bcb.csb.utoronto.ca/bcb410-applied-bioinformatics/

cmCourseInfo.description: Current approaches to using the computer for analyzing and modeling biology as integrated molecular systems. Lectures plus hands-on practical exercises. The course extends and complements an introductory Bioinformatics course, such as BCH441H1.
cmCourseInfo.title: Computational Systems Biology
cmCourseInfo.prerequisitesText: BCH441H1/CSB472H1 or permission of the course coordinator

breadthTypes.description: BR=5 The Physical and Mathematical Universes

notes.name: Course Note
notes.content:
Timetable Instructions

<p>For more information about this course, please visit the course website: https://bcb.csb.utoronto.ca/bcb420-systems-biology/</p>

courses.name: Advanced Special Project in Bioinformatics and Computational Biology

cmCourseInfo.description: An opportunity for advanced specialized individual research in bioinformatics and computational biology by arrangement with a supervisor. Approval of the application by the BCB coordinator is required. BCB330Y1 is a recommended preparation for this course however students should not normally conduct their project in the same laboratory or continue their previous project. Not eligible for CR/NCR option.
cmCourseInfo.title: Advanced Special Project in Bioinformatics and Computational Biology
cmCourseInfo.prerequisitesText: Permission of the course coordinator (application required). Significant background in both life science and computer science courses is required.

breadthTypes.description: BR=5 The Physical and Mathematical Universes
